data.title: 2024 National Doctors' Day
data.text:
In recognition of Doctors' Day, the Emory School of Medicine Recognitions Committee sent out a call for nominations for doctors across the School of Medicine who go above and beyond. More than 200 Emory faculty members were nominated by their peers and colleagues for their dedication to improving the health and well-being of our patients and community through the care they provide, the research they conduct and their efforts to teach and inspire learners.

The committee reviewed each nomination and selected those who exemplify the outstanding faculty of the Emory School of Medicine. The quotes below were taken from the nomination materials.

Department of Medicine Nader Aboujamous Emory Saint Joseph's Hospital

Dr. Nader Aboujamous's positive attitude is contagious. His ability to connect with colleagues and patients alike, as well as his ability to provide excellent patient care, makes him a valuable asset to ESJH. He would make an incredible leader one day, as he somehow balances his clinical duties, extracurricular work activities (he is on numerous committees) and family life seamlessly. He is always calm and collected even during a complex situation. He looks at issues from every angle before making an informed decision. He is never judgmental, gives feedback in the most professional way and always try to see the best in everyone, which are all qualities of a great leader.

Department of Pediatrics Melissa Adams

Dr. Melissa Adams is always patient and kind and deftly calms worried parents. Her private practice patients adore her, and she goes above and beyond to make sure that they are assigned to see her if at all possible. She models excellence in patient care with teaching of medical students and residents. She comes to work with a cheerful, can-do attitude that positively impacts her patients and everyone in clinic.

Department of Surgery Hanna Alemayehu Children's Healthcare of Atlanta

Dr. Hanna Alemayehu has been a game changer since her hire, personally elevating the care delivered at CHOA Scottish Rite over the past 2 years. In the NICU, she piloted a refeeding program that was long overdue and has improved nutritional outcomes for the babies. In adolescents, she has personally developed a chest wall malformation clinic that has elevated the care delivery to cutting edge for safety and outcomes. She has also reinvigorated the robotic surgery program, a long overdue addition.

Department of Medicine Shirine Allam Atlanta VA Medical Center

Dr. Shirine Allam is a clinical expert and leader in ILD. Her compassion and dedication for her patients is evident in the countless hours she spends not just in clinic, but after hours, helping patients obtain transplant referrals across the country, assisting colleagues who are taking care of them when they are admitted, and ensuring her patients have what they need to lead quality lives. Dr. Allam is a committed educator, teaching trainees and colleagues about ILD so that high quality care continues.

Department of Anesthesiology Christen Allred Emory University Hospital

Dr. Christen Allred is one of the most compassionate anesthesiologists at EUH. She works well with patients, anesthetists and trainees. Dr. Allred stands up to some of the most challenging cases in the Emory University Hospital ORs and shines in them.

Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences Rachel Ammirati Grady Memorial Hospital

Dr. Rachel Ammirati is a fierce advocate for her patients, routinely going above and beyond to ensure that they’re treated equitably within the healthcare system, have access to needed services and resources, and are afforded every opportunity to thrive. Dr. Ammirati is the "go-to" behavioral health clinician whose consultative work contributes meaningfully to enhancing the quality of transdisciplinary clinical service delivery for patients.

Department of Family and Preventive Medicine Amir Antonios The Emory Clinic

Dr. Amir Antonios has only been in practice for a year at Emory and he has received recognition for his outstanding patient care. Patients find him a very compassionate doctor and a great listener. He responds to portal messages within 24 hours and is rated highly by his patients for his communication skills and responsiveness.

Department of Medicine Meghana Anugu Emory University Hospital Midtown

Dr. Meghana Anugu is nominated for National Doctors' Day because of her exceptional patient care and resident education at Emory Midtown Clinic. Her evidence-based, empathetic approach, combined with a commitment to patient communication, exemplifies her dedication. Her efforts in guiding patients through vulnerable times and fostering resident growth highlight her significant impact, making her an exemplary candidate for recognition.

Department of Dermatology Laura Aspey Grady Memorial Hospital

Dr. Laura Aspey has been Chief of Service of the Dermatology Center at Grady Health System since 2014. She is a tireless advocate for underserved patients and families. During her tenure, Dr. Aspey has grown the Dermatology Center faculty footprint, patient access, collaboration with other service lines, telemedicine service and outreach clinics. Her warm, compassionate, and selfless interpersonal style draws people to her, including patients, families, mentees, and colleagues.

Department of Pediatric Emergency Medicine Yvonne Atherly-John Children's Healthcare of Atlanta

Dr. Yvonne Atherly-John is an excellent physician, an epitome of positivity, always has a smile on her face when she comes in to her shift. She continues this positivity in her interactions with residents and fellows and in the care of her patients. She is Co-chair of the Physician community outreach committee and has used her skills to foster better communication (leading to better care) between community pediatricians and the emergency department

Department of Family and Preventive Medicine Bernadette Baker Emory University Hospital Midtown, The Emory Clinic

Dr. Bernadette Baker is a wonderful physician for her patients. She provides excellent care and is a pleasure to work with.

Department of Medicine Dylan Baker Grady Memorial Hospital

Dr. Dylan Baker is a phenomenal primary care doctor who consistently delivers compassionate, patient-centered, and evidence-based care.

Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences Carissa Balderas Emory University Hospital, The Emory Clinic

Dr. Carissa Balderas’s compassionate approach to guiding transplant patients through the emotional complexities of the transplant process sets a high standard for excellence in care. She is a strong advocate for equity and evidence-based integrated care. Her empathetic, caring demeanor not only fosters healing within her patients, but also enriches our team dynamic. Dr. Balderas is deeply respected by her patients, colleagues, and trainees. She is an invaluable asset to our team and to the patients she sees, as evidenced by both my personal experience in peer consultation with her as well as the unsolicited praise shared by our mutual patients for her tireless efforts and integral role in their progress.

Department of Pediatrics Tamara Ball Children's Healthcare of Atlanta

Dr. Tamara Ball is the epitome of a pediatrician. Her smile lights up the ED during every shift and she builds great relationships with families. Her clinical acumen is unparalleled and we feel lucky to call her our friend and colleague.

Department of Medicine Jessica Barnes Emory University Hospital

Dr. Jessica Barnes is a dedicated and compassionate clinician. She's an excellent advocate for her patients and a wonderful teammate.

Department of Otolaryngology Emily Barrow Emory University Hospital Midtown

Dr. Emily Barrow is an exceptional surgeon and an outstanding colleague. In her time as faculty thus far, Dr. Barrow has distinguished herself as a committed, and generous 'go-to' faculty member at Emory. Her interpersonal skills are superb and she is a stellar role model to the residents and fellows within her specialty program. When Dr. Barrow and I discuss a patient case, I am often impressed by her curiosity and her advocacy for patients and for best practices.

Department of Medicine Sivan Ben-Moshe Emory Decatur Hospital, The Emory Clinic

Dr. Sivan Ben-Moshe is a dedicated clinician, teacher and advocate who is loved and respected by her patients and families. She dedicates a great deal of time to each patient and is clearly truly passionate about providing the best care. She doesn't hesitate to reach out to consultants to discuss challenging cases and ensure her patients receive the best and most timely care. In addition, she is bringing geriatric education to a diverse group of trainees. She is a thoughtful colleague, always willing to volunteer her time to teach and advocate for our Geriatrics division. She also directs the Aging and Dying course by collaborating with many colleagues and specialties to enhance patient care.

Department of Radiology Zachary Bercu Emory University Hospital, Emory University Hospital Midtown, Winship Cancer Institute

Dr. Zachary Bercu is the best interventional radiologist. He treats patients and their families with respect and care. He understands the complex situations they face when they come to see him. As an interventional radiologist, his professionalism and enthusiasm is contagious.

Department of Hematology and Medical Oncology Leon Bernal-Mizrachi Grady Memorial Hospital

Dr. Leon Bernal-Mizrachi is an exceptional physician who always goes above and beyond to help his patients and colleagues. He is incredibly generous with his time and is always available to assist others, even when he is busy. Dr. Bernal-Mizrachi fights tirelessly to ensure that his patients and staff receive the best possible care, often working behind the scenes to make things happen. I am grateful to have the opportunity to work with such a highly respected individual.

Department of Pediatric Emergency Medicine Nehal Bhandari Children's Healthcare of Atlanta

Dr. Nehal Bhandari's dedication to providing compassionate and thorough care to our patients is truly commendable. She is a gem of a clinician, educator and advocate, always going the extra mile. Her attention to detail, expertise, and commitment to staying current with medical advancements make a significant difference in the lives of our patients. It is a privilege to work alongside her. Dr. Bhandari is precisely the kind of doctor I would want to care for my child if they were sick.

Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences Anjan Bhattacharyya Emory Decatur Hospital, Emory University Hospital, Emory University Hospital at Wesley Woods, The Emory Clinic

Dr. Anjan Bhattacharyya has distinguished himself as an exemplary clinician. He receives stellar comments from his colleagues in hospital medicine and psychiatry on the high quality of care he provides with a strong record of consult and inpatient care. His prior accomplishments along with his performance at Emory enabled him to achieve the Clinical Distinction of Eminent Physician and nomination to the Hall of Fame at Emory Decatur Hospital. He also is the Chief of Clinical Psychiatry.

Department of Emergency Medicine Eliot Blum Grady Memorial Hospital

Dr. Eliot Blum is one of the most caring physicians I have ever met and is loved by all. He will sit at the bedside with a patient in need and spend time getting to know them while putting in an IV and drawing blood. He pays close attention to detail and builds rapport with his patients; they trust him and love him for it. If I were to ever get sick, I would want him taking care of me.

Department of Family and Preventive Medicine Laura Brachman Emory Saint Joseph's Hospital

Dr. Laura Brachman is one of the best palliative care physicians. She can easily remedy a difficult goals of care conversation. After such discussions, it is obvious that patients and their families respect her perspective. In addition, her clinic patients adore her and always ask if Dr. Brachman is in the hospital so she can care for them while they are admitted.

Department of Anesthesiology Caitlin Bradley Grady Memorial Hospital

Dr. Caitlin Bradley has had a major impact on clinical care across Grady's division of anesthesiology. She is Grady's chief of cardiothoracic anesthesiology and leads our point-of-care ultrasound (POCUS) team, performing a high volume of perioperative ultrasounds. She also coordinates care of our obstetric patients with high-risk cardiac conditions.

Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences Kara Brendle The Emory Clinic

Dr. Kara Brendle has been a committed and inspiring associate director of adult outpatient psychiatry. She spearheaded a very successful effort to provide a number of psychotherapy groups which has significantly increased access to psychotherapy services among patients. She is a highly committed therapist who goes above and beyond for her patients. She has also facilitated community among psychologists which improves our work life and helps us treat patients even more effectively. I have always appreciated her insights into patient care and help with guiding patients through emotionally difficult transitions.

Department of Pediatrics Courtney Byrd Children's Healthcare of Atlanta

Dr. Courtney Byrd is an absolutely wonderful person, colleague and physician. Her clinical knowledge is meticulous and thorough. She establishes a rapport with patients and families with ease; she is affable, warm and practices family-centered care. She has also established a high flow nasal canula bronchiolitis protocol that has truly changed our practice nationally.

Department of Hematology and Medical Oncology Lorraine Cafuir Emory University Hospital, Emory University Hospital Midtown

Dr. Lorraine Cafuir is an exemplar of a stellar hematologist. She skillfully cares for patients with the most complex bleeding disorders and other hematologic abnormalities. She couples this with a positive, upbeat, and friendly style that is respected and appreciated by her patients. Her knowledge and collegial nature are equally appreciated by her colleagues. Dr. Cafuir energizes the hematology clinics and consult services with her enthusiasm, and upholds the highest standards of Emory patient care.

Department of Emergency Medicine Michael Carr Emory University Hospital

Throughout my time shadowing Dr. Michael Carr, I have been consistently impressed by his dedication to patient care and clinical practice. Dr. Carr combines medical expertise and a compassionate bedside manner to approach each patient with empathy. He actively listens to patient concerns, acknowledging the anchoring effect, as he tries to deliver outstanding care. Dr. Carr's contribution to patient care is deserving of celebration.

Department of Dermatology Justin Cheeley Emory University Hospital, Emory University Hospital Midtown, Grady Memorial Hospital, The Emory Clinic

Dr. Justin Cheeley provides exceptional patient care both in the clinic and in the hospital. He is a rare gem double boarded in dermatology and internal medicine. His patients benefit from his ability to manage the most complicated diseases and severe presentations, raving about him in their reviews.

Department of Pediatrics Bruce Chien Children's Healthcare of Atlanta

Dr. Bruce Chien is a phenomenal pediatrician and a pleasure to work with. He is constantly making his peers and patients laugh. His calm demeanor is refreshing in a high stress, high acuity ED.

Department of Surgery Michael D. Clark Emory Saint Joseph's Hospital

Dr. Michael D. Clark is one of the vascular surgeons who you do not hesitate to call when you are stuck. He is always available to help and never gives any push back. His experience goes a long way as well. His patients all love him and respect him. He is well respected at ESJH.

Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences Christina Clarke The Emory Clinic

Dr. Christina Clarke is a fabulous and dedicated clinician, who has committed to expanding access to care to individuals of identities traditionally underserved in the mental health community. She has brought much needed expertise to the Emory clinic in her knowledge of adaptations to treatment to best support black women in getting mental health services, including starting a group focused on black women's wellness. She is also a kind, calm presence in our clinic as a team member.

Department of Radiology Dan Cohen-Addad Emory Johns Creek Hospital, Emory Saint Joseph's Hospital, Emory University Hospital, Emory University Hospital Midtown, Grady Memorial Hospital, The Emory Clinic

Dr. Dan Cohen-Addad is a young and exceptionally talented emergency and neuroradiologist who goes above and beyond to provide timely, accurate, and clinically relevant diagnostic radiology interpretations to patients throughout the Emory and Grady health systems. In just the few years since he has joined our practice, he has exhibited tremendous growth in his clinical skills. Dr. Cohen's commitment to his patients and community is commendable.

Department of Family and Preventive Medicine Kimberly Curseen The Emory Clinic

Dr. Kimberly Curseen is a compassionate palliative care physician and exceptional leader. Her kindness and relationship-centered approach have transformed the Supportive Care Clinic, fostering remarkable growth over the past decade. We are thankful for her unwavering dedication to patients and exemplary leadership.

Department of Medicine Reema Dbouk The Emory Clinic

Dr. Reema Dbouk takes excellent care of her primary care patients. She addresses obesity with a non-judgmental approach and seeks to educate others in primary care to improve equity in weight management. She also demonstrates leadership in innovative technology programs within primary care and is presenting data on her pilot project to improve pneumococcal vaccine rates at a national meeting. She is also eager to include others in her academic efforts.

Department of Pathology and Laboratory Medicine Edward Dent Emory University Hospital

Dr. Edward Dent demonstrates dedication to delivering the highest standard of patient care. He invests time in direct communication with fellow specialists engaged in patient treatment and fosters consensus, particularly in complex cases. Dr. Dent’s patience in expertly navigating challenging clinical scenarios and his consistently positive outlook make him a role model in our department.

Department of Family and Preventive Medicine Paul DeSandre Grady Memorial Hospital

Dr. Paul DeSandre oversees inpatient and outpatient practices, providing exemplary care to patients with serious illness. His commitment to patient care makes him a shining example at Grady.

Department of Medicine Chandan Devireddy Emory University Hospital Midtown

Dr. Chandan Devireddy is an interventional cardiologist with specialized expertise in complex minimally invasive procedures for severe coronary atherosclerotic disease, peripheral vascular disease, and structural heart disease and who is focused on delivering the most effective, appropriate, and quality care. Recently, after over 10 years of dedication and effort, he performed the first FDA-approved procedure for renal denervation in the Southeast for management of resistant hypertension.

Department of Medicine Abdoulaye Diallo Emory Saint Joseph's Hospital

Dr. Abdoulaye Diallo is a hidden gem. He is very unassuming, but he does a lot for his colleagues. He is our Epic champion and has worked very hard in making our Epic experience great. He is selfless, never complains, and works very hard in taking excellent care of his patients. We have never seen him mad or upset due to his calming demeanor and personality. We are extremely lucky to have him on our team.

Department of Radiology and Imaging Sciences Karin Dill Emory Johns Creek Hospital, Emory Saint Joseph's Hospital, Emory University Hospital, Emory University Hospital Midtown, Winship Cancer Institute

I have found no one who understands cardiovascular disease better than Dr. Karin Dill. Her knowledge base is laudable. What truly sets her apart is her application of that knowledge. Surgical disciplines value prompt decisions and action. Dr. Dill embodies this proactive principle. She never shies away from a difficult case and commits herself to a diagnosis. She treats each image as a proxy for the patient and invests herself in that patient’s care. She cares about the patient, not just the image.

Department of Radiation Oncology Sunil Dutta Emory Saint Joseph's Hospital

Dr. Sunil Dutta’s forward thinking and evidence-based clinical care has transformed the way Emory cares for breast and GI cancer patients. He has worked tirelessly with the Emory Proton Center nursing, physics, and dosimetry teams to optimize care and minimize side effects, bringing suggestions and knowledge from his continual communication with other proton departments across the country. His enthusiasm, excellent patient care and leadership have benefited our patients tremendously.

Department of Medicine Rina Eisenstein Atlanta VA Medical Center

Dr. Rina Eisenstein has been a chief of the geriatric clinic at the VA for many years. She brings all her energy, enthusiasm, and commitment to caring for older veterans, teaching and lecturing. She goes extra mile to care for the veterans as well as staff at the clinic. She is highly professional and dependable in most difficult situations. She also has chaired Emory Southeast Conference for care of the older adult.

Department of Hematology and Medical Oncology Fuad El Rassi Emory University Hospital Midtown, Grady Memorial Hospital

Dr. Fuad El Rassi provides exemplary dedication to ensuring his sickle cell patients (SCP) receive comprehensive care. He takes the time to educate them about their conditions, treatment options, and preventive measures, empowering them to make informed decisions about their health. His commitment to improving the health and well-being of SCP makes him truly deserving of this accolade.

Department of Otolaryngology Mark El-Deiry Emory University Hospital Midtown

Dr. Mark El-Deiry demonstrates commitment to quality clinical care and innovation in Head and Neck Surgical Oncology at Emory. His vision and leadership played a crucial role in establishing Emory's Head and Neck Multidisciplinary Clinic at Winship Emory Midtown. Alongside his exceptional surgical skills, his compassion for patient care and humanism are evident in his collaborative patient-related cases.

Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences Erin Elliott Atlanta VA Medical Center

Dr. Erin Elliott is the current Acting Deputy Chief of the Mental Health Service Line at the Joseph Maxwell Cleland Atlanta VA Healthcare System. She is also a talented psychologist who is generous and empathic with both her teams and her patients. She has an outstanding work ethic which is evident in her commitment to serving our nation’s veterans. She advocates for veterans and clinical teams as she is often engaged in processes aimed at reducing barriers to care and improving employee morale. She is passionate about providing clinical services particularly to individuals struggling with severe mental illnesses. She is a true advocate for these individuals and provides emphatic support to their loved ones.

Department of Medicine Shruti Erramilli Emory University Hospital Midtown

Dr. Shruti Erramilli has been a ray of sunshine at Emory Midtown. She is a team player and has been a great addition to our team, helping to assist with sick patients on cross over and involving consultants after hours to make sure patients receive appropriate care. She is an excellent communicator. She goes above and beyond for her patients.

Department of Surgery Felix Fernandez Emory University Hospital

Dr. Felix Fernandez is a real patient advocate. He is able to think outside the box. He is willing to take risks, but does so only after consulting with all relevant parties and discussing the risks and benefits with the patient to ensure his patients receive the best care possible. It is obvious that he really cares about his patients and his craft. Not only is he a very talented and skilled thoracic surgeon, he also does a great job connecting and communicating with his patients and their family members. He explains things clearly and thoughtfully, takes time to answer questions, and empowers his patients to make the best choices for themselves.

Department of Anesthesiology Michael Fiedorek Children's Healthcare of Atlanta

Dr. Michael Fiedorek is the Assistant Program Director for the Pediatric Anesthesiology Fellowship. He is always going the extra mile to care for his patients as a pediatric cardiac anesthesiologist and works tirelessly to improve patient safety in the operating room.

Department of Family and Preventive Medicine Hillary Fitzgerald Emory Saint Joseph's Hospital

Dr. Hillary Fitzgerald is a fantastic physician in palliative medicine. She demonstrates empathy and excellent communication skills in her patient care. She works collaboratively with colleagues, nursing, and interdisciplinary teammates to ensure patients and families have space and opportunity to make informed decisions in difficult illness, and that their preferences and voices are heard. Dr. Fitzgerald goes above and beyond to care for her patients and encourages us to do the same by her example.

Department of Pediatrics Kiesha Fraser-Doh Children's Healthcare of Atlanta

Dr. Kiesha Fraser-Doh continues to be a fierce advocate for patient safety. This is so ingrained in her daily interactions. She has and continues to use her position as a pediatric emergency medicine physician to speak up for and educate parents and colleagues on safe practices for the most vulnerable population (children) to improve patient care.

Department of Medicine Stephen Frohwein Emory Saint Joseph's Hospital

Dr. Stephen Frohwein is one of the best Cardiologists I have worked with. His patients all love and respect him. He never hesitates to help when you call him, and he is immediately at bedside shortly after you speak to him. I would trust my family with Dr. Frohwein.

Department of Human Genetics Michael Gambello Children's Healthcare of Atlanta, The Emory Clinic

Dr. Michael Gambello is one of the most talented and well respected medical geneticists in the country. He also is a genuine and compassionate leader. For over 3 years, Dr. Gambello has consistently contributed more than 4 hours a week, in addition to his clinical responsibilities, to see additional pediatric patients in need of genetic service. He recognizes the high demand for genetics while resources are low and dedicates more of his time to see more patients than required.

Department of Pediatrics Katie Gartin Children's Healthcare of Atlanta

Dr. Katie Gartin is a nocturnal gem. She goes the extra mile for her patients and takes on difficult procedures like a boss. We are lucky to have her in our division!

Department of Radiation Oncology Heather Gatcombe Emory Decatur Hospital

Dr. Heather Gatcombe has elevated the patient experience at Emory Decatur by providing patient centric care focused on wellness. Her efforts on wellness have extending beyond her own clinic to champion wellness activities for providers across the network in the Department of Radiation Oncology. Her efforts in this space are of great value to her patients, which is evident by her glowing patient satisfaction feedback and to the staff at Emory Decatur Hospital.

Department of Pathology and Laboratory Medicine Jatin Ghandi Emory University Hospital Midtown

Dr. Jatin Ghandi is a highly respected and talented pathologist that we are so fortunate to have on-site at Emory Midtown. In addition to his outstanding diagnostic acumen, Dr. Ghandi is recognized for his talents as an educator, and a sense of workplace positivity that enhances the functioning of the EUHM-WEM team.

Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences David Goldsmith Grady Memorial Hospital

Dr. David Goldsmith is a well-respected psychiatrist and researcher who has made significant contributions to the area of brain-immune interactions in schizophrenia. Dr. Goldsmith has trained the next generation of researchers, provided excellent patient care, and made outstanding contributions to the scientific community. But what is most commendable is his devotion and care for his patients who have had the most difficult to treat clinical illnesses.

Department of Radiology and Imaging Sciences Sean Goodin Emory Saint Joseph's Hospital

Dr. Sean Goodin consistently goes above and beyond in his care for patients, especially at Emory Saint Joseph's Hospital. He comes early and stays late to ensure all aspects of the patient's care is attended to. He takes extra time to speak with family members in person and on the phone. As an image-guided proceduralist, he will often address common issues during the initial consultation in the patient room without imaging guidance to save the patient a procedure!

Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences Alyson Goodwin

Dr. Alyson Goodwin goes above and beyond to provide exceptional care to her patients. She works to connect her patients to additional services to maximize their benefit, in effect transcending the siloes that can be endemic to the typical healthcare setting. Her prioritization of patients' well-being is obvious.

Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences Jennifer Grant Grady Memorial Hospital

Dr. Jennifer Grant cares for patients with severe and persistent mental illness in an acute setting. She is a fierce advocate for her patients.

Department of Medicine Sharon Graves Emory University Hospital

Dr. Sharon Graves displays constant empathy toward her patients. She dedicates herself to the care of her patient, taking it upon herself to review labs and information at all hours, to reach out to colleagues for advice and to provide the best treatment plan. She weighs not just clinical outcomes, but the needs and feasibility of how any treatment will impact her patients.

Department of Medicine Meredith Greer Grady Memorial Hospital, The Emory Clinic

Dr. Meredith Greer goes above and beyond to care for patients in the sleep clinic, creating urgent access when needed. She is an eager medical educator, always willing to volunteer her time to teach student and residents.

Department of Otolaryngology Jennifer Gross Emory University Hospital Midtown

Dr. Jennifer Gross's surgical technical expertise translates to life-saving importance for many patients with oral, head, and neck tumors at Emory. This type of reputation contributes to Emory's standing as a regional and national referral center for complex head and neck disorders. Her approachable and professional demeanor cultivates an environment around her that encourages clinical excellence and collaboration, and makes her an excellent role model.

Department of Pediatrics Lokesh Guglani Children's Healthcare of Atlanta

Dr. Lokesh Guglani is an excellent pediatric pulmonologist who established and directs the primary ciliary dyskinesia (PCD) program. Once he set up this multidisciplinary program with ENT, pulmonology, genetics, and pathology, patients now receive top-notch multidisciplinary care in one clinic. Patients with suspected PCD come from all across Georgia to be evaluated in this reputed clinic. His patients highly compliment the care they receive and appreciate the coordinated care.

Department of Medicine Cliff Gunthel Grady Memorial Hospital

Dr. Cliff Gunthel is the Director of the Oncology Program at the Grady Ponce de Leon Center. He has provided clinical mentorship to countless faculty and trainees across levels in HIV-associated malignancies as a master clinician with expertise in infectious diseases and hematology-oncology. Through his service, he has ensured the provision of patient-centered care for a highly underserved population in Metro Atlanta. Importantly, Dr. Gunthel himself provides this care with an exemplary bedside manner and an empathetic approach.

Department of Urology Mohammad Hajiha Atlanta VA Medical Center, Emory Johns Creek Hospital

Dr. Mohammad Hajiha brings tireless commitment and dedication to his patients to resolve their urological conditions with exceptional skill and caring.

Department of Otolaryngology James Hamilton Grady Memorial Hospital

Dr. James Hamilton is an exceptional surgeon, leader, and role model. He serves as a source of equanimity during high-intensity or stressful times, modeling integrity and professionalism in the clinic, operating room, and workplace. Dr. Hamilton supports interdisciplinary collaboration to clarify understanding of unusual clinical findings and/or resolve challenging patient care dilemmas, thus enhancing high quality patient care and safety.

Department of Pediatrics Kelli-Lee Harford Children's Healthcare of Atlanta

Dr. Kelli-Lee Harford is a sleep psychologist and an integral part of the pediatric sleep medicine team. She goes above and beyond for her patients by accommodating them when they have other appointments on the same day. She is very proactive and a team player. Her work is critical to ensure that children can successfully utilize their CPAP machine by teaching coping mechanisms and resolving any barriers.

Department of Radiology and Imaging Sciences Peter Harri Emory University Hospital

Dr. Peter Harri provides great patient care by reading a tremendous number of exams to help maintain timeliness of reports. Dr. Harri also creates and improves processes through his leadership role in Informatics to further optimize patient care.

Department of Neurology Taylor Harrison Grady Memorial Hospital

Dr. Taylor Harrison is a highly dedicated neurologist at Grady Memorial Hospital who uniquely specializes in infectious neurologic conditions. His colleagues routinely seek his guidance on complex neuro-infectious diseases cases. His expertise in this area is unparalleled across the health system. He is truly the role model of an outstanding physician.

Department of Otolaryngology Jeanne Hatcher Emory University Hospital Midtown

Dr. Jeanne Hatcher goes above and beyond to make her transgender patients feel seen and heard when managing their voice issues. She is also a strong advocate for physician wellness, which impacts not only the lives of her colleagues, but also those of patients that they treat.

Department of Pediatrics Sunita Hemani Children's Healthcare of Atlanta

Dr. Sunita Hemani is a compassionate, thoughtful and dedicated physician. She provides exceptional care and support to her patients and their families throughout their hospitalization. She is a strong advocate for improving care for children with asthma. Additionally, Dr. Hemani’s passion for physician wellness is inspiring. She consistently goes above and beyond to find ways to bring wellness to the hospitalist division.

Department of Pediatrics Nicole Hendrix

Dr. Nicole Hendrix offers patient-centered care through her Early Intervention program, seeing some of our youngest patients and coaching parents to engage their child and teach social communication skills. She is extremely caring, helping families to achieve goals with their children. Families are uniformly satisfied with Dr. Hendrix, with feedback coming in with top ratings. Dr. Hendrix is one of the most compassionate clinicians I have ever seen.

Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences Adriana Hermida Emory Decatur Hospital, Emory University Hospital, The Emory Clinic

Dr. Adrianna Hermida has made important and impactful national and international service contributions in geriatric psychiatry and, at the same time, has developed a geriatric clinic that provides expert care to geriatric patients in Emory Healthcare and the Southeast. She is a true triple threat whose professional contributions are complemented by her strong personal character, work ethic, impeccable honesty and integrity, and collaborative interpersonal style.

Department of Pediatrics Samantha Hill Grady Memorial Hospital

Dr. Samantha Hill is an outstanding physician who always has her patients' interests at the top of her mind. Her personal passion for fostering healthy adolescent development is evident. She will go to every length to get what her patients need for their care and is a fierce advocate for systems level change for patients.

Department of Rehabilitation Medicine Mark Hinrichs Grady Memorial Hospital

Dr. Mark Hinrichs is an outstanding physician. He consistently demonstrates caring and compassion for the patients he work with. Dr. Hinrichs is also extremely collaborative, supporting various professionals he works with. This team approach enhances the recovery of his patients.

Department of Medicine Jeanne Ho Grady Memorial Hospital

Dr. Jeanne Ho is very humble and quiet about how much she advocates for her patients in various ways. She goes above and beyond in every way imaginable from obtaining proper medications to helping make patients' hospitalizations more comfortable. Furthermore, her advocacy for patients to other doctors is immeasurable.

Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences Karen Hochman Atlanta VA Medical Center

Dr. Karen Hochman is an excellent clinical psychologist a mentor and teacher to trainees. She is passionate about working with veterans with substance disorders, and shares her knowledge and experience freely with future clinicians.

Department of Pediatrics Jennifer Hodnett

Dr. Jennifer Hodnett has dedicated her almost 17-year professional career to developing systems and programs to engage patients and families with support services grounded in behavior analysis. She pursues opportunities to further the efficacy of our practice and to build connections with the larger community. She strives to cultivate a safe and enriching environment for our patients and families to thrive.

Department of Pediatrics Sherita Holmes Children's Healthcare of Atlanta

Dr. Sherita Holmes is a world class attending. She is the PEM fellowship director and someone we can always count on for help on tough clinical cases. Sherita is a wonderful colleague, so knowledgeable, a master clinician, always willing to go the extra mile to help out other physicians, nurses and staff and always keeps patients first. She is always the first one to compliment and acknowledge others’ contributions. She’s a great role model and truly deserving of this award.

Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences Jennifer Holton Children's Healthcare of Atlanta, The Emory Clinic

Dr. Jennifer Holton is a recognized expert in child psychiatry who won the 2024 Psychiatrist of the Year in Georgia. Dr. Holton has also been acknowledged both locally, regionally, and nationally as one of the top doctors in psychiatric practice and has been given the award as the Atlanta Magazine Top Doctors more than once.
